resources.string: If you have any questions about BrainAware, our data privacy and security policy, or you would like to exercise one of your data protection rights, please do not hesitate to visit our website or contact us.
Understand and manage your mental fitness based on your smartphone usage.
Use our app to get daily scores on key mental fitness indicators related to stress.

If you regularly use more than one phone (e.g., a business and a personal one), you can pair additional devices with your participation ID here so that the usage of all your devices contributes to your personalized metrics.\nThis function is only available with a stable Internet connection.
Delete data and end data collection in the app
You are about to delete this journal entry, this operation cannot be undone.
Next, the app will take a few days to learn your tapping and typing patterns.
You will get a notification as soon as your first scores are ready.
You have successfully completed the onboarding.
Most common scores for healthy people
How can I record my Notes?
Journal is the tab of the Dashboard which lets you record lifestyle changes and notes on any given day.
Track, understand, and manage your mental fitness based only on the timing patterns of your smartphone usage.
See your progress after a lifestyle change or discover how different aspects of your mental fitness influence each other.
Identify which of your activities benefit you most or when it’s time to recharge your batteries.
Use unique brain health metrics to make informed decisions to improve your mental fitness and wellbeing.
You will be able to see the trends of your scores in personalised graphs.
To keep track of how lifestyle changes impact your mental fitness,\nyou can add short notes in the\napp journal.
Using your scores and your notes, you will be able to track, understand, and learn how to manage your mental fitness.

In all 14 days and 6 weeks graphs of the app, you may see dots under some days which indicates that you have entered notes for those days. You can click on one of these dots and the Note will be displayed in a popup so you don’t have to go to the Journal to see it.

**Why are Notes useful?**

you can check what behavioural changes happened before a change in the trend of your scores, so you can discover how different lifestyle changes are related to your scores, so you can discover how different life events are related to your scores. They can help you understand your ups and downs and be a good starting point to form new habits. 
Your Notes do not affect your scores. 
######
**How can you browse the Journal?**

There are two views of the Journal. You can switch between them on the toggle button at the bottom of that screen:
**How can you create a Note?**\n\nTo create a Note click on the button at the bottom of that screen.

It will take you to a new screen where you can enter all the details for the Note:
 
 - set the day that the Note is for 
 - select the lifestyle changes you want to make or have made and how you have changed them. 
 - enter your detailed notes

Relations is the tab of the Dashboard which lets you see the trend history of your scores for all the indicators at the same time. This way, you will be able to discover how the indicators affect each other and how you can better manage them.

In the 14 days and 6 weeks view, you can also discover how your lifestyle changes may impact your score. Look for the days prior to a change in your scores, and then click on the grey dots below those days. This will open the associated Note for that time and you can check if there is a relation. You will learn about Notes in Lesson 13.

**Which part of my trend history can I see?**

There are three options for the length of the interval of the history displayed: 14 days, 6 weeks or 12 months.

#####

**How is the trend history displayed?**

The trend history is displayed in the graph, which is easily understandable with its clearly marked plot, categories, and legend. The legend is interactive so you can choose which indicators you need displayed.
Where can I discover how the indicators affect each other?
The main part of the app is the Dashboard. Its first tab is Indicators, and this is where you see all your daily scores.

**How long until I can see my scores?**
Your initial scores take a few days to compute since the app is getting to know your interaction patterns. The time needed for each indicator is shown by the progress bar.

#####

**What do the score values mean?**
Scores for each indicator are computed on a scale of 0–100. This score also tells you where you stand compared to other people, including those who are not healthy. For instance, if your score is 75, it means that you are doing better than 75% of the population. Scores are divided into three categories: low (0–33), medium (34–66), and high (67–100).

The multi-day scores, averages and trends help you focus on the long-term development of your mental fitness, which is more relevant than daily fluctuations.

#####

**How do I see my score trends?**
Clicking on any of the indicators on the overview screen will open its details where you can see your scores over different periods of time in comparison with the healthy general population i.e. people in your age and gender group.

Remember that daily fluctuations in your scores are normal. Your score trend over a period of time is what is important for you to understand your mental fitness. Additionally, your individual development is what matters the most; the graph merely orients your understanding of where your scores lie in a general population.
How can I see my scores?
This channel notifies you of when the scores are ready, and when changes happen
All today’s scores are ready. You can see them in the app
Your %s score has changed significantly. Would you like to add a note about any specific event?
Check out your score trends over the past month!
Check out your score trends over the past week!

Notifications can be beneficial for you to track your indicators and overall progress. You can customize how regularly you want us to remind you to check your indicators or turn off notifications any time.\n\nApart from periodic scheduled notifications, you can choose to receive notifications when there is a significant change in your indicator. This can help you to quickly check your habits and life events at that time.

The only data we collect through this permission is the timing patterns of your screen touches. We cannot record where you tap or the content of your screen in any form. The app will not display anything on your screen when you’re not using it.

I agree to the collection, processing, and storage of anonymised data related to the names and usage frequency of my apps. This data might be shared with third-parties in aggregated form, ensuring that individual records remain unidentifiable.

All data gathered through the app is anonymised and completely private.\n\nWe do not track any input or capture any content from your phone—anything you type, read, and view on your phone remains completely private.

How to give permission:
1. The button below takes you to phone settings.
2. If a list appears, choose BrainAware.
3. On the next page, click on the slider to enable.
4. Press the back button TWICE to return to this screen.

In order to provide you with the most accurate outcomes, we need two permissions for this app to run in the background.

Our algorithm only uses the timing patterns of your screen touches, your app usage patterns and the frequency with which you use your device.

With the permissions requested, we cannot collect any information beyond what is mentioned. And most importantly, we only collect data anonymously.
We minimise permissions and maximise outcomes for you.
The only data we can collect through this permission are the names of the apps and how often you use them. We do not record any content from the app or any other details.
At QuantActions we care about your privacy.
This feature will be available as soon as your first scores are ready.
We need a bit more time\n\nThe app has not collected enough data to compute your scores. Please keep using your phone as usual, and we’ll notify you once we’re ready. Thank you!
Find out more about the app through the tutorial.
We need just a little more time to get to know you!
We will notify you about changes and improvements in your scores.\n\nYou can customise the point in time and the frequency of your notifications in your app settings.
You can customise the point in time and the frequency of your notifications in your app settings.
I would like to receive notifications.

Scan the QR code above with the device you want to pair. You will be redirected to the Play Store. Download the app and open it directly from the Play Store. The device will automatically be paired with your identity ID. \n \nIf the app is already installed on your additional device, start the app onboarding on this device. Select \'Pair device\' on the profile page and scan the QR code above. The device will be paired automatically.

If you want to unpair/deactivate a device, perform one of the following options on the phone where you no longer want to use the app:

1. Stop data collection and delete data via main settings screen

 2. Uninstall the app

Why do we ask for this info?
This information is used to show your data in relation to a group with similar age and gender.
We further analyse this data to learn and measure human behavior with the goal to improve our products for you and adapt them to group-specific needs.

How do we handle this info?
Your personal information is voluntary and stays completely private, secure and anonymous.
This information will be processed and stored in anonymised form only without any link to your person. This information will not be used for a discriminatory purpose.
Would you like to share some profile data with us?
Your new note has been created!
What is this app all about?
Would you like to receive notifications?
You are about to delete all your data from BrainAware and end the data collection. The app will be closed

This information is voluntary and stays completely private, secure and anonymous.

Providing it allows us to give you insights into your data trends in comparison with a similar age and gender group.

You can also answer these questions later in your app settings and see details about why we ask for this data and how we use it.
Your phone usage has been low for the past few days.
Your scores will be computed once you start using this phone regularly again.
You can keep your data. Manage your devices in the Settings.
The range shows where the most common scores are for healthy people in the same age and same gender group as you. Your profile information can be updated in

The owl count shows how many times your potential sleep time was interrupted that night by using your phone. Phone uses that take place within the same 20 minutes are counted as the same interruption.

The owl count shows how many times your potential sleep time was interrupted on average per night during that week by using your phone. Phone uses that take place within the same 20 minutes are counted as the same interruption.

The owl count shows how many times your potential sleep time was interrupted on average per night during that month by using your phone. Phone uses that take place within the same 20 minutes are counted as the same interruption.
I consider myself to be healthy
This function is not available for the sample note!
In months with fewer days than selected, notifications are sent on the last day of that month.
Notifications will be sent as soon as the scores are ready but not earlier than this time.
You have disabled the permission(s) required for the app.\nThe app can no longer compute your scores until you enable the permission(s).

In order to provide you with the most accurate outcomes, we need two permissions for this app to run in the background.

Our algorithm only uses the timing patterns of your screen touches, your app usage patterns and the frequency with which you use your device.

With the permissions requested, we cannot collect any information beyond what is mentioned. And most importantly, we only collect data anonymously.

You can pause data collection in the Settings.
To do this, please go to the Settings.
Scores for all of your metrics are now ready!

You are about to send us your device ID by email. By sending us your device ID, we receive a link between your email address and your data. We will only use your device ID to process your request. We will delete this link as soon as your request has been successfully completed.

The coloured area shows the range of the values within which the true score is likely to lie. \nIt indicates how accurate our estimate of the score is, and typically depends on intensity of your phone use. The larger the range for a given score, the more caution is needed in interpretation.

The 14-day score is an average of all scores from the last 14 days. Remember that daily fluctuations in your scores are normal. Important for understanding your mental fitness is the development of your scores over a period of time.
The 6-week score is an average of all scores from the last 6 weeks. This score helps you to focus on the medium-term development of your health.
The 12-month score is an average of all scores from the last 12 months. This score helps you to focus on the long-term development of your health.

To estimate your short-term trend, we compare the average of your metric over the last 7 days with the average of the 7 days before. We focus on changes that happen consistently and put less weight on individual days that are very different from the others.\n\nWe tell you if a change is unusually large compared to what is normal for you. What is normal for you might be different from what is normal for someone else. If you typically have big changes from day to day, a big change from week to week might not be that unusual.

To estimate your mid-term trend, we compare the average of your metric over the last 2 weeks with the average of the 4 weeks before. We focus on changes that happen consistently and put less weight on individual days that are very different from the others.\n\nWe tell you if a change is unusually large compared to what is normal for you. What is normal for you might be different from what is normal for someone else. If you typically have big changes from week to week, a big change from month to month might not be that unusual.

To estimate your long-term trend, we compare the average of your metric over the last month with the average of the 11 months before. We focus on changes that happen consistently and put less weight on individual days that are very different from the others.\n\nWe tell you if a change is unusually large compared to what is normal for you. What is normal for you might be different from what is normal for someone else. If you typically have big changes from month to month, a big change from year to year might not be that unusual.
We recommend performing the following steps in your phone\'s battery settings to ensure the app runs without interruption:\n 1. Click on \"Battery\".\n 2. Select \"Unrestricted\".

We recommend performing the following steps in your phone's battery settings to ensure the app runs without interruption:
 1. Find BrainAware in the list of apps.
 2. Toggle to deactivate the system management.
 3. Click 'OK' to confirm.
 4. The app entry should show now "Managed manually".

We recommend performing the following steps in your phone's battery settings to ensure the app runs without interruption:
 1. Click on "Battery usage".
 2. Toggle to activate both:
 a) "Allow background activity"
 b) "Allow auto launch"

We recommend performing the following steps in your phone's battery settings to ensure the app runs without interruption:
 1. First toggle to allow "Auto launch".
 2. Click on "Battery saving".
 3. In the next screen select "Unrestricted".

A problem occurred while activating your app. To fix it, please click again on the activation link on your phone that you received from us by email. This will open and activate the app.\n\nSuccessful activation is then confirmed either by a message on the dashboard or by the arrival of your scores.
I don\'t have an activation link, what should I do?

Your trial period is coming to an end soon. \n\nIf you\'ve been enjoying our app and want to continue, now is the perfect time to subscribe. Unlock all the amazing features of our app by subscribing today in the Settings.

Your subscription has expired.\n\nYour subscription has expired. But don\'t worry, you can easily subscribe again and regain access to all the amazing features of our app. Subscribe now in the Settings to enjoy our app to the fullest again.

	• Get access to more indicators, helping you better understand your progress
	• See trends that make your development visible
	• Link your life events to your data for even deeper insights with our Journal
Don't miss out on these amazing features and start enjoying our app to the fullest.
Your subscription expires on [%s].\n\nDon\'t miss out on all the amazing features of our app. Renew your subscription now in the Settings. to continue enjoying our app to the fullest.

Your score is computed on a scale of 0–100. The score also tells you where you stand compared to other people, including those who are not healthy. For instance, if your score is 75, it means that you are doing better than 75% of the population.

Scores are divided into three categories: 
0–33: low
34–66: medium
67–100: high

To cancel your subscription, click on the link and you will be redirected to the Google Play Store. If you cancel your subscription, a free plan with limited features will automatically start on to_cancel_google_sub.
After expiry of your plan, a free plan with limited features will automatically start on %s.\n\nWe will show you all subscription options here one week before the expiry date.
